CONCLUSION: Preliminary objections dismissed (victim, non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born on DATE and currently resides in GPE . He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practicing in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was apprehended by police officers of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's house was searched , during which ammunition was found .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with storing ammunition ( Article CARDINAL of LAW ) and a criminal investigation was initiated against him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was terminated due to lack of proof .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged complaints with the Kievsky ORG of Odessa , claiming unlawful detention , and the unlawful search and seizure of some of his property . The applicant alleged that the search was conducted without a warrant and that no ammunition had been found . He also sought compensation for moral damage caused by the unlawful police action .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Kievsky ORG of Odessa allowed the applicant 's claims and ordered ORG to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG partly quashed this decision as regards compensation for material damage , which it remitted for fresh consideration to the GPE ORG of Odessa , which at DATE awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation for pecuniary damage . It also ordered ORG to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation for moral damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG about the non - execution of the judgment of DATE given in his favour .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that no funds were available for such payments in the DATE State budgets .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested ORG to execute the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant there was no statutory procedure for the payment of compensation and therefore no payment was possible .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG CARDINAL to the applicant in compensation for pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG to the applicant in compensation for non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is set out in the judgment of DATE in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
